content.rendered:
Pizza made into cookies? The best of both worlds have officially combined! Use a cookie cutter to make cute shapes like hearts and stars as your pizza base and decorate with your favourite veggie toppings! Vegan-friendly, fun to make and tasty to eat!

Ingredients

Ingredients
For the pizza base:
2 cups flour (you can use whole-wheat flour, if desired)
1 tbsp yeast
¼ tsp Salt
1 tbsp sugar
⅔ cup lukewarm water (plus an additional 2 tbsp)
For the toppings (here are some ideas but feel free to get creative and choose your own):
Fry’s Original Vegan Hot Dogs, defrosted and sliced
1 cup Pizza / Tomato sauce
Vegan cheese, grated
Olives, pitted
Tomatoes, sliced
Bell peppers, chopped
Fresh basil

Directions

Preheat the oven to 190°C.

In a big bowl, mix 1 cup of flour with all other pizza base ingredients.

Gradually add the second cup of flour until it forms a ball.

Use your hands to knead the dough.

Let the dough rest for 10- 15 Minutes in the bowl covered with a dish towel to keep it warm.

Throw some flour on a clean table surface. Roll out the pizza dough until it becomes a thin base.

Use your cookie cutters to cut shapes out of the dough.

Arrange the mini cookie pizzas slightly apart on greased baking sheet.

Spread a thin layer of tomato sauce over each pizza. Sprinkle with your veggie toppings and vegan cheese.

Bake your little pizzas in the oven for about 10- 15 Minutes, until the dough is cooked through and cheese is melted.
